author: Trucked
text:
Well, I'm kinda happy that the JPN Bros seems to care so much about Holoen (unless it's a bunch of us using Google Translate), but I don't like what happened because of that.

I am more used, like many I presume, to Solo-Streamers. So, in one hand I don't see the big deal with Rushia doing her own thing. People can watch archives later of either of them (Rushia or Heloen). 

On the other hand, this is a company with multiple talents, which means some sort of coordination is expected I guess? for their own interest. So I do understand where these comments come from, but even then there's only that much you can do. Conflicting schedules, miscommunication, being on a different branch, personal issues, time-zones. What happened to ''Shoganai''?!

Personally, like yesterday, if I see a bunch of Hololives streaming at the same time, I just watch my favorite while keeping the others on mute, but with their stream open in a tiny pinned tab in the background in order to give them views. Sometimes maybe I jump from stream to stream.

I mean, you can do this. You're free to manage yourself, it's not her job to manage us. Rushia streaming doesn't block us from watching the Debuts. It didn't block me.

I'm not that into the whole Idol culture, for me they're just Funny/Multi-Talented Streamers. I don't care if someone overlaps someone else, or I don't lose my mind if something like what happened to Towa occurs. So, maybe I don't understand how some people that are into it actually think/feel. I'm ignorant. However, there is a limit of how far you can go, right?

Edit: It seems that the translator OsaKana deliberately blew it out of proportions with his personal flavored translation and dramatic cut-editing. This isn't my opinion, it's what is being said on YouTube and Reddit. There's only one side of the story out for now, but it looks like many have pointed this out and the translator himself took down the video. Disregard the ''incident'' cause there wasn't one.
